page.title: 11Changes in Tresillian (1)
page.content: The most immediate and visible changes in this area are the changing of a few houses into a commuter village.The reasons for this are probably the wider use of the road. This was widened to cater for a larger number of vehicles and as more people went into Truro the more crowded Truro became.So Tresillian became a commuter village, populated by a lot of people who work in Truro. Shops too have changed through the past four decades.Some have diminished ,others have newly opened. Travelling shops have totally disappeared now ,these include laundry vans, grocer vans, fish man, oil man etc. Other standing shops have gone and the post office is the only shop in use after 40 years.Now there is a recently opened farm produce shop and this has made up a little for the lack of shops
